Articles.Content:
spookydonut: Nope. Read the rule. It applies only to mods that upload personally-identifiable information, which, as the OP explains, this does not. Version checkers and the like are specifically excluded by Rule 6.

Although it is still polite to ask if they want to check like that AVC thing does. Personally I have KSP forbidden all access in the firewall, simpler and no worries.

I can also confirm that I get serious frame rate issues with this installed, the lag goes away if I turn off the entire UI (F2) and its not constrained to the flight scene but also lags the VAB.

This is with the 32bit windows version of KSP.
I can confirm the atrocious performance - rendered the game unplayable, I didn't try the UI switch though. Linux 64-bit.

And another huge performance hit - I didn't get out of the VAB without uninstalling :-(

(Aged x86 CPU and Windows 7.something)
x64, heavily modded, poor frame rate. confirmed.

For the performance issue if I can get some more details that would be ace:

  • Does it happen whether or not the window is open?
  • Anyone happy to share a save/logs so I can be in the same situation - less mods is better in this scenario I guess

I haven't tried it in either of my in-use KSP instances yet but I figured I'd try to help out. I loaded a new instance of the game with 0 mods other than this one. I had no noticeable performance issues even while plotting during liftoff.

I was just saying to myself yesterday... I said... "Self, wouldn't it be cool if Kerbal Space Program had a mod for generating porkchop plots in-game?"

...And here it is! Magic! Thank you, thank you!
This would be good if it would work together with MJ's maneuver planner

I was only having performance issues with a kerbal on EVA on the surface of Ike everything else seemed fine enough. Didn't happen when kerbal was on EVA in space around same vessel. Window was closed and installed in the stock toolbar.
Can that display the trajectory node?

I'll change the locking code on my trip home from work and upload a new one tonight, I cant see anything else thats running when the thing is idle

When the porkchop is "cooking" I expect some impact, but can't tell you how much as its sort of hidden from the plugin
I am getting massive lag with this mod installed when in the hangar or VAB, even with the window closed. Linux 64.
I'm getting bad lag as well on Windows 8.1 x64 with KSP x64 heavily modded. Deleted this mod and fixed everything right up. Unfortunate given how cool this mod seems!
I am also getting unplayable lag in the VAB and SPH with this mod installed, nothing obvious in the logs either

People said it all! Great tool, now in-game! It's a perfect combination!

Thank you, I'll be giving it a try soon!

Changed all the locking code.... and sadly that wasn't the problem. Was very nearby that though, so thanks micha for the pointer ( for reference it was Unity's FindObjectsOfType method - dont normally use this one and thus the "new" issue )

Tweaking a few other quick things and then will have a new version

New version is now up - sorry it took so log my dev machine decided it was time for some "fun"

Let me know how it goes
Would it be possible to have earliest leave date default to the current date/time? It would be nice for when you are running a bunch of transfers trying to decide where to go.

Let me know how it goes

All performance problems apparently resolved. Previously unusable (win 7 x86), now no noticeable slowdown.
Thanks so much for this, going to save me a lot of alt-tabbing.

Would it be possible to have earliest leave date default to the current date/time? It would be nice for when you are running a bunch of transfers trying to decide where to go.

Thats a good idea - will put it in

All performance problems apparently resolved. Previously unusable (win 7 x86), now no noticeable slowdown.

Thanks for the info Pecan - appreciate it

Sweet I came back to say I loaded this up in my game with other mods and had terrible framrate lag, and I find it's been updated.

+1 Internet to all!
Performance is fixed for me. Thanks!
This is a brilliant mod idea. Can't wait to try it out myself!
